When Little Red Riding Hood went into the woods to pick flowers, the wolf went straight to her grandmother’s house. He knocked on the door and heard a voice ask “Who is it?” ‘It’s me, Little Red Riding Hood. I’ve brought you bread, butter, cake and berries”, the wolf said, disguising his voice. “How lovely! Give the door a big push and come in. I don’t have the strength to come and open it.”
The wolf roared, jumped off the bed and ate the poor girl whole.

Her grandmother looked strange. “Oh, Grandma, what big ears you have!” exclaimed Red Riding Hood. “All the better to hear you with!” the wolf replied in a fake voice. “Oh, Grandma, what big eyes you have!” she continued. “All the better to see you with!” the wolf said. “Oh, Grandma, what big hands you have!” “All the better to grab you with!”, the wolf said. “Oh, Grandma, what a big mouth you have!” exclaimed Red Riding Hood. “All the better to eat you with!” The wolf roared, jumped off the bed and ate the poor girl whole.

A huntsman, who was passing by the house, heard him and thought it was very strange for the old woman to snore so loudly. He looked inside and saw the wolf. The huntsman took a pair of scissors and cut open the wolf’s belly.
The three ate some cake, happy in the knowledge that the wolf was not going to be a danger anymore.
